revised_title: Upper Limits of Continuous Beta-Ray Spectra of Thorium C and C"
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to determine the upper limits of the continuous beta-ray spectra of thorium C and C". They used a magnetic spectrograph and a sensitive coincidence counter to measure the end points of the thorium bodies. The results showed that the maximum energies liberated in the two branches of thorium C balance, in agreement with the prediction of Ellis and Mott.
